title: Ticket #2147: Optionally encode date/time in rotated log file names
description:
Some users like having the date and possibly time included in the filenames of rotated log. So instead of having

  history, history.1, history.2, history.3

you might have

  history, history.2011-05-05, history.2011-05-04, history.2011-05-03

(This particular example assumes ROTATE_HISTORY_DAILY=TRUE.)

It would be nice if this was an option for some or all log files that we rotate. The user who requested the feature was interested in the schedd's HISTORY log.

Benefits:

  • A given log file, once "aged", never moves, providing consistency for the user.
  • Instead of having to rename all of the old files and delete the oldest, you just delete the oldest.

Drawbacks:

  • Identifying the oldest log file is trickier, especially if the mtime isn't reliable.
  • If you let the user specify the format (probably using something like a strftime formatting string), it becomes possible for two filenames to collide.
remarks:
2011-May-10 17:11:43 by adesmet:
The user who originally asked (admin 22103) was interested in having the history files include the date as a way to speed up condor_history calls. The benefit would be decidedly dubious, although I've put out a request for more information. While as an option this idea remains appealing for the reasons above, demand seems low and the benefits small.
